translated: praising, yawning, function for the sake of the responsibility of embodied beings, performing creation, dissolution, concealment, grace, etc.

original: kurvantītyarthaḥ // / /
analyzed: kurvanti iti arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: sarvajñaśabdo bhāvapradhānaḥ sarvakartṛtvādy upalakṣayati // / /
analyzed: sarvajña śabdaḥ bhāva pradhānaḥ sarva kartṛ tva ādi upalakṣayati
translated: The word omniscient is predominant in the abstract sense and implies all-doership and so on.

original: yathā dehināṃ karaṇāny upapāditadṛśā tadbalamākramya viṣayaprakāśādau pravartante iti dṛṣṭāntaḥ // / /
analyzed: yathā dehinām karaṇāni upapādita dṛśā tad balam ākramya viṣaya prakāśa ādau pravartante iti dṛṣṭāntaḥ
translated: Just as the sense organs of embodied beings, by the power of that [omniscience], function in the illumination of objects and so on, as seen, this is the example.

original: tathā nirañjanāḥ kṛtakṛtyatvān nivṛttādhikāramalāḥ śāntaviśiṣṭavācakātmasvarūpās
analyzed: tathā nirañjanāḥ kṛtakṛtya tvāt nivṛtta adhikāra malāḥ śānta viśiṣṭa vācaka ātma svarūpāḥ
translated: Similarly, the stainless ones, having accomplished their purpose, having removed the impurity of responsibility, having the nature of the supreme and distinguished denotative self,

original: tatraiva spandātmake bale samyagabhedāpattyā prakarṣeṇāpunarāvṛttyā līyante adhikamalānmucyante
analyzed: tatra eva spanda ātmake bale samyak abheda āpattyā prakarṣeṇa apunarāvṛttyā līyante adhika malāt mucyante
translated: in that very power which is of the nature of vibration, merge by the attainment of complete non-difference, by the highest non-return, are released from the excess of impurity,

original: ārādhakacittena upāsakalokasaṃvedanena saha // / /
analyzed: ārādhaka cittena upāsaka loka saṃvedanena saha
translated: along with the awareness of the world of the worshipper's mind.

original: yathoktam /
analyzed: yathā uktam
translated: As it is said:

original: anugṛhyāṇusaṃghātaṃ yātāḥ padam anāmayam // / /
analyzed: anugṛhya aṇu saṃghātam yātāḥ padam anāmayam
translated: Having favored the aggregate of atoms, they have gone to the state of health.

original: iti // / /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: yataśca tata evoditāstadbalena visṛṣṭās tatraiva līyante tenaite mantramantreśvarādayaḥ
analyzed: yatas ca tatas eva uditāḥ tad balena visṛṣṭāḥ tatra eva līyante tena ete mantra mantreśvara ādayaḥ
translated: And from which they arise, emitted by its power, and dissolve back into it, therefore these Mantras, Mantra-Lords, etc.

original: śivasya parameśvarasya sambandhī dharmaḥ svabhāvo vidyate yeṣāṃ te tathā sāmānyaspandasārā
analyzed: śivasya parameśvarasya sambandhī dharmaḥ svabhāvaḥ vidyate yeṣām te tathā sāmānya spanda sārā
translated: They have the attribute, the nature, of Śiva, the Supreme Lord. They are the essence of the universal vibration.

original: ityarthaḥ // / /
analyzed: iti arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: nanu karaṇānāṃ mantrāṇāṃ ca tat udayādau tulye kimiti karaṇāni na sarvajñādirūpāṇi // / /
analyzed: nanu karaṇānām mantrāṇām ca tat udaya ādau tulye kim iti karaṇāni na sarvajña ādi rūpāṇi
translated: Now, if the arising, etc. of the senses and the Mantras are the same, why are the senses not of the nature of omniscience, etc.?

original: ucyate parameśvaro māyāśaktyā śarīrakaraṇāni bhedamayāni nirmimīte vidyāśaktyā tv ākāśīyavicitravācakaparāmarśaśarīrān mantrān // / /
analyzed: ucyate parameśvaraḥ māyā śaktyā śarīra karaṇāni bheda mayāni nirmimīte vidyā śaktyā tu ākāśīya vicitra vācaka parāmarśa śarīrān mantrān
translated: It is said that the Supreme Lord, by his power of Māyā, creates the body and senses, which are full of distinctions, but by his power of Vidyā, he creates the Mantras, whose body is the reflective awareness of the various words that are like space.

original: vācakasya māyāpade 'pi // / /
analyzed: vācakasya māyā pade pi
translated: Even at the level of Māyā, the denotator

original: ghaṭo 'yam ityadhyavasā nāmarūpātirekiṇī /
analyzed: ghaṭaḥ yam iti adhyavasā nāma rūpa atirekiṇī
translated: This is a pot - the ascertainment that transcends name and form,

original: pareśaśaktirātmeva bhāsate na tv idaṃtayā // / /
analyzed: pareśa śaktiḥ ātmā iva bhāsate na tu idaṃtayā
translated: Shines like the power of the Supreme Lord, like the Self, but not as this.

original: iti pratyabhijñoktanītyā pramātṛbhūmyanatikrānter na śarīrapuryaṣṭakādivadbodhasaṃkocakatvam astīti yuktamevaiṣāṃ sarvajñatvādi // / /
analyzed: iti pratyabhijñā uktanītyā pramātṛ bhūmi anatikrānteḥ na śarīra puryaṣṭaka ādi vat bodha saṃkocaka tvam asti iti yuktam eva eṣām sarvajña tva ādi
translated: According to the method stated in the Pratyabhijñā, because it does not transcend the realm of the knower, it does not have the nature of contracting consciousness like the body, the eight material substances, etc. Therefore, their omniscience, etc. is proper.

original: etac ca /
analyzed: etat ca
translated: And this.

original: bhede tv ekarase bhāte // / /
analyzed: bhede tu ekarase bhāte
translated: But when it shines as one in diversity,

original: iti śrīpratyabhijñākārikāṭīkāyāṃ vitatya darśitam // / /
analyzed: iti śrī pratyabhijñā kārikā ṭīkāyām vitatya darśitam
translated: Thus it has been extensively shown in the commentary on the Verses on Recognition.

original: evaṃ vidyāpadāvasthitasṛṣṭyādikāryanantabhaṭṭārakādyapekṣayaitad vyākhyeyam // / /
analyzed: evam vyākhyeyam
translated: Thus, this should be explained with reference to the supreme Lord who has the endless effects such as creation, etc., situated in the state of the Vidyā pada.

original: tathā dīkṣādipravṛttānām ācāryādīnāṃ karaṇarūpāḥ sarve mantrās tatspandatattvarūpaṃ
analyzed: tathā dīkṣā ādi pravṛttānām ācārya ādīnām karaṇa rūpāḥ sarve mantrāḥ tad spanda tattva rūpam
translated: Similarly, all the mantras which are the instruments of the teachers etc. who are engaged in initiation etc.,

original: balam ākramya anuprāṇakatvena avaṣṭabhya ācāryādīnām eva sambandhinārādhakacittena
analyzed: balam ākramya anuprāṇaka tvena avaṣṭabhya ācārya ādīnām eva sambandhinā ārādhaka cittena
translated: overpowering the power which is of the nature of the vibration of that (Vidyā pada), and supporting it as the vital force,

original: saha mokṣabhogasādhanādyadhikārāya pravartante tatraiva śāntavācakaśabdātmakaśarīrarūpā
analyzed: saha mokṣa bhoga sādhana ādi adhikārāya pravartante tatra eva śānta vācaka śabda ātmaka śarīra rūpā
translated: operate for the sake of the right to accomplish liberation, enjoyment, etc., along with the mind of the worshipper who is related to the teachers etc. There itself, they are of the form of the body which is of the nature of words that express peace.

original: ata eva ca nirañjanāḥ śuddhāḥ samyak pralīyante viśrāmyanti // / /
analyzed: atas eva ca nirañjanāḥ śuddhāḥ samyak pralīyante viśrāmyanti
translated: And for that very reason, they are pure, unstained, and completely merge, i.e., rest.

original: atra vyākhyāne sahārādhakacittena iti pūrvaślokena yojyam // / /🔽evaṃ ca mantrāṇāmudayapralayakoṭivyāpi pravṛttāv api bhittibhūtamiti abhihitam // / /
analyzed: atra vyākhyāne saha ārādhaka cittena iti pūrva ślokena yojyam  evam ca mantrāṇām udaya pralaya koṭi vyāpi pravṛttau api bhitti bhūtam iti abhihitam
translated: In this explanation, along with the mind of the worshipper should be connected with the previous verse.🔽Thus, it is said that even in the operation of mantras which extends to millions of rising and merging, they are the ground.

original: evaṃ ca daśāṣṭādaśādibhedena bhinne śaive mantrāṇāṃ spandatattvasārataivetyuktaṃ bhavati // / /
analyzed: evam ca daśa aṣṭādaśa ādi bhedena bhinne śaive mantrāṇām spanda tattva sāra tā eva iti uktam bhavati
translated: And thus, it is said that even in the mantras of Śiva which are divided into ten, eighteen, etc., they are essentially the essence of the vibration principle.

original: evaṃ mantramantreśvarādirūpā śuddhābhimatā sṛṣṭiḥ śivasvabhāveti pratipādyādhunā
analyzed: evam mantra mantreśvara ādi rūpā śuddha abhimatā sṛṣṭiḥ śiva svabhāvā iti pratipādya adhunā
translated: Thus, having taught that the creation considered pure, in the form of mantras, mantra lords, etc., is of the nature of Śiva,🔽now, in order to establish that even the creation considered impure, in the form of māyā, etc., is of the nature of Śiva,

original: aśuddhābhimatāpi sā māyādirūpā śivasvarūpaiva iti upapādayan śrīmataśāstrādirahasyadṛṣṭim🔽api upakṣipati // / /
analyzed: aśuddha abhimatā api sā māyā ādi rūpā śiva svarūpā eva iti upapādayan śrī mata śāstra ādi rahasya dṛṣṭim  api upakṣipati
translated: he introduces the secret view of the Śrīmata scripture, etc.

original: yasmātsarvamayo jīvaḥ sarvabhāvasamudbhavāt /
analyzed: yasmāt sarva mayaḥ jīvaḥ sarva bhāva samudbhavāt
translated: Since the individual soul is composed of everything, and because of the origin of all things,

original: tatsaṃvedanarūpeṇa tādātmyapratipattitaḥ // / //
analyzed: tad saṃvedana rūpeṇa tādātmya pratipattitaḥ
translated: by the form of the experience of that, through the realization of identity with that,

original: tasmācchabdārthacintāsu na sāvasthā na yā śivaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt śabda artha cintāsu na sā avasthā na yā śivaḥ
translated: therefore, in thoughts about words and meanings, there is no state that is not Śiva.

original: bhoktaiva bhogyabhāvena sadā sarvatra saṃsthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhoktā eva bhogya bhāvena sadā sarvatra saṃsthitaḥ
translated: The enjoyer itself is always present everywhere in the form of the object of enjoyment.

original: yato jīvo grāhakaḥ sarvamayaḥ śivavad viśvarūpaḥ tena hetunā śabdeṣu vācakeṣu artheṣu
analyzed: yatas jīvaḥ grāhakaḥ sarva mayaḥ śiva vat viśva rūpaḥ tena hetunā śabdeṣu vācakeṣu artheṣu
translated: Since the individual soul, the experiencer, is composed of everything, and is of the form of the universe like Śiva, for that reason, in words that express, or in meanings

original: vācyeṣu cintāsu vikalpajñānādirūpāsu ādimadhyāntarūpā sāvasthā nāsti yā śivo na bhavati
analyzed: vācyeṣu cintāsu vikalpa jñāna ādi rūpāsu ādi madhya anta rūpā sā avasthā na asti yā śivaḥ na bhavati
translated: that are expressed, or in thoughts that are in the form of conceptual knowledge, etc., there is no state that is not Śiva, whether in the beginning, middle, or end.

original: sarvameva śivasvarūpam ityarthaḥ // / /
analyzed: sarvam eva śiva svarūpam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that everything is of the nature of Śiva.

original: yataś caivamato bhoktaiva cidātmā grāhako bhogyabhāvena dehanīlādirūpeṇa sadā nityaṃ
analyzed: yatas ca evam atas bhoktā eva cit ātmā grāhakaḥ bhogya bhāvena deha nīla ādi rūpeṇa sadā nityam
translated: And since this is so, therefore, the individual soul itself, the experiencer, the conscious self, is always,

original: sarvatra vicitratattvabhuvanādipade samyaganūnādhikatayā sthitaḥ na tu bhogyaṃ nāma
analyzed: sarvatra vicitra tattva bhuvana ādi pade samyak anūna adhika tayā sthitaḥ na tu bhogyam nāma
translated: Everywhere, in the various principles, worlds, etc., it abides correctly, without deficiency or excess, and not as something called enjoyed,

original: kiṃcidbhoktur bhinnam asti // / /
analyzed: kiṃcid bhoktuḥ bhinnam asti
translated: which is different from the enjoyer.

original: jīva ityupakramya śiva ityupasaṃhāreṇa jīvaśivayorvāstavo na ko 'pi bhedaḥ iti
analyzed: jīvaḥ iti upakramya śivaḥ iti upasaṃhāreṇa jīva śivayoḥ vāstavaḥ na kaḥ pi bhedaḥ iti
translated: Beginning with jīva (individual soul) and concluding with Śiva, there is no real difference at all between the jīva and Śiva.

original: dehādyavasthāsu na kāsucid apyapūrṇamanyatā mantavyā api tu cidghanaśivasvabhāvataiveti
analyzed: deha ādi avasthāsu na kāsucid api apūrṇa manya tā mantavyā api tu cidghana śiva svabhāva tā eva iti
translated: Therefore, in no condition of the body, etc., should one think of being incomplete or different, but rather of being of the nature of Śiva, who is dense consciousness.

original: bhaṅgyopadiśati // / /
analyzed: bhaṅgyā upadiśati
translated: He teaches this through various expressions.

original: yathoktam śarīramapi ye ṣaṭtriṃśattattvamayaṃ śivarūpatayā paśyanti arcayanti ca
analyzed: yathoktam śarīram api ye ṣaṭtriṃśat tattva mayam śiva rūpa tayā paśyanti arcayanti ca
translated: As it is said: Those who see the body as consisting of the thirty-six principles in the form of Śiva and worship it,

original: te sidhyanti ghaṭādikam iva tathābhiniviśya paśyanti arcayanti ca te 'pīti nāstyatra🔽vivādaḥ iti śrīpratyabhijñāṭīkāyām // / /
analyzed: te sidhyanti ghaṭa ādikam iva tathā abhiniviśya paśyanti arcayanti ca te pīti na asti atra  vivādaḥ iti śrī pratyabhijñā ṭīkāyām
translated: they attain success, just as they see and worship a pot, etc., by being absorbed in that way. There is no dispute here.

original: bhaṭṭaśrīvāmanenāpyuktam /
analyzed: bhaṭṭa śrī vāmanena api uktam
translated: Thus in the commentary on the Pratyabhijñā by the illustrious Vāmana, it is said:

original: ālambya saṃvidaṃ yasmāt saṃvedyaṃ na svabhāvataḥ /
analyzed: ālambya saṃvidam yasmāt saṃvedyam na svabhāvataḥ
translated: Since the object of experience is not by nature dependent on consciousness,

original: tasmātsaṃviditaṃ sarvamiti saṃvinmayo bhavet // / /
analyzed: tasmāt saṃviditam sarvam iti saṃvid mayaḥ bhavet
translated: therefore everything is known through consciousness. Thus one should be full of consciousness.

original: iti // / /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: kasmāt jīvaḥ sarvamayaḥ ityatra hetuḥ sarvabhāvānāṃ samudbhavād utpattihetutvāt apādānabhāvapradhānaśca nirdeśaḥ // / /
analyzed: kasmāt jīvaḥ sarva mayaḥ iti atra hetuḥ sarva bhāvānām samudbhavāt utpatti hetu tvāt apādāna bhāva pradhānaḥ ca nirdeśaḥ
translated: Why is the individual soul all-pervading? The reason is stated here: because of the origin of all things, i.e., because it is the cause of the origin of all things. The statement is primarily in the form of an apadi form.

original: pramātṛmitimānameyamayabhedajātasya te vihāra iha hetutāṃ samupayāti yasmāt tvayi /
analyzed: pramātṛ miti māna meya maya bheda jātasya te vihāraḥ iha hetu tām samupayāti yasmāt tvayi
translated: That is your abode here, which is the cause of the variety of objects of knowledge consisting of the knower, the means of knowledge and the object of knowledge, because it is so.

original: nivṛttavivṛtau kvacit tad apayāti tenādhvādhunā nayena punarīkṣyate jagati jātucitkenacit // / /
analyzed: nivṛtta vivṛtau kvacid tat apayāti tena adhvā adhunā nayena punar īkṣyate jagati jātucit kenacid  /
translated: When there is cessation of the open state somewhere, that state of yours disappears. Therefore, by this method, the path is seen again and again by someone in the world.

original: iti śrījñānagarbhastotroktanītyā saṃvidyeva prasṛtāyāṃ jagataḥ sadbhāvāt sarvabhāvasamudbhavatvaṃ
analyzed: iti śrī jñānagarbhastotra uktanītyā saṃvidyā iva prasṛtāyām jagataḥ sadbhāvāt sarva bhāva samudbhava tvam
translated: Thus, in accordance with the method stated in the hymn Jñānagarbha, the world exists only when consciousness expands. Therefore, the individual soul is all-pervading.

original: jīvasya yataśca jīvādeva udayati viśvamato'yaṃ sarvamayo viśvaśaktiriti yāvat // / /
analyzed: jīvasya yatas ca jīvāt eva udayati viśvam atoyam sarva mayaḥ viśva śaktiḥ iti yāvat
translated: And from the individual soul itself, the universe arises. Therefore, this [individual soul] is all-pervading, i.e., it is the power of the universe.

original: nirṇītaṃ caitad dvitīyasūtravṛttau // / /
analyzed: nirṇītam ca etat dvitīya sūtra vṛttau
translated: And this has been determined in the commentary on the second aphorism.

original: sarvamayatve hetvantaramāha tatsaṃvedana ityardhena // / /
analyzed: sarva maya tve hetu antaram āha tad saṃvedane iti ardhena
translated: In the all-pervadingness, he states another reason in the half verse beginning with 'tat-saṃvedana'.

original: tasya sarvasya nīlasukhāderyatsaṃvedanaṃ prakāśastena rūpeṇa svabhāvena tādātmyapratipatteḥ sarvamayatvasyopalambhāt // / /
analyzed: tasya sarvasya nīla sukha ādeḥ yat saṃvedanam prakāśaḥ tena rūpeṇa svabhāvena tādātmya pratipatteḥ sarva maya tvasya upalambhāt
translated: By that consciousness, i.e., by the light of that all, such as blue and pleasure, by that form, i.e., by that nature, by the attainment of identity with that, by the perception of all-pervadingness.

original: evamanena ślokadvayena rahasyacaryāḥ sarvabhedapādaponmūlopapattiparighaṭitāś ca
analyzed: evam anena śloka dvayena rahasya caryāḥ sarva bheda pādapa unmūla upapatti parighaṭitāḥ ca
translated: Thus, by these two verses, the secret practices and the discourses on the teachings of knowledge, which are arranged with the attainment of uprooting the tree of all differences,

original: jñānopadeśakathāḥ prathamacaramasūtrābhyāṃ mahārthatattvaṃ jāgradādisūtreṇa ṣaḍardhaparamārthaḥ
translated: the great truth with the first and last aphorisms, the supreme truth of the six and a half with the aphorism on waking and so on,

original: tadākramya ity anena sarvopāsāsāratetyādyupakṣiptam iti spandatattvenaiva viśvopadeśāḥ🔽svīkṛtāḥ // / /
analyzed: tat ākramyaḥ iti anena sarva upāsā sāra tā ityādi upakṣiptam iti spanda tattvena eva viśva upadeśāḥ  svīkṛtāḥ
translated: and by having conquered, what was implied such as the essence of all worship and so on, thus the teachings of the universe are accepted only through the principle of vibration.

original: athaitatpratipattisārataiva mokṣa ityādiśati // / /
analyzed: atha etat pratipatti sāra tā eva mokṣaḥ iti ādiśati
translated: Then, he declares that the very essence of the realization of this is liberation and so on.

original: iti vā yasya saṃvittiḥ krīḍātvenākhilaṃ jagat /
analyzed: iti vā yasya saṃvittiḥ krīḍā tvena akhilam jagat
translated: Thus, he whose consciousness is of the entire universe as play,

original: sa paśyansatataṃ yukto jīvanmukto na saṃśayaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa paśyan satatam yuktaḥ jīvanmuktaḥ na saṃśayaḥ
translated: he, always seeing, being absorbed, is liberated while living, there is no doubt.

original: vāśabdaḥ prathamaniḥṣyandoktanimīlanasamādhiprakāraṃ vikalpayan asyāḥ samāpatter durlabhatāṃ dhvanayati // / /
analyzed: vā śabdaḥ prathama niḥṣyanda ukta nimīlana samādhi prakāram vikalpayan asyāḥ samāpatteḥ durlabha tām dhvanayati
translated: The word or distinguishes the method of the meditation of closing the eyes mentioned in the first outflow, and suggests the difficulty of attaining this.

original: tenāyamarthaḥ īdṛśī tāvatsaṃvittiḥ durlabhā yasya kasyacid evāpaścimajanmano bhavati so 'khilaṃ jagatkrīḍātvena paśyan nijasaṃvidunmeṣanimeṣābhyāṃ
analyzed: tena ayam arthaḥ īdṛśī tāvat saṃvittiḥ durlabhā yasya kasyacid eva apaścimajanmanaḥ bhavati saḥ u khilam jagat krīḍā tvena paśyan nija saṃvid unmeṣa nimeṣābhyām
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning: Such consciousness is difficult to attain, and it occurs only for someone in their last birth. He, seeing the entire universe as play,

original: sṛjan saṃharaṃś ca /
analyzed: sṛjan saṃharan ca
translated: creating and dissolving it by the opening and closing of his own consciousness.

original: mayyāveśya mano ye māṃ nityayuktā upāsate // / /
analyzed: mayi āveśya manaḥ ye mām nitya yuktāḥ upāsate
translated: Those who, fixing their minds on Me, worship Me, ever devoted,

original: iti sthityā satatasamāviṣṭo mahāyogī jīvann eva prāṇādimān api vijñānāgninirdagdhāśeṣabandhano
analyzed: iti sthityā satata samāviṣṭaḥ mahā yogī jīvan eva prāṇa ādimān api vijñāna agni nirdagdha aśeṣa bandhanaḥ
translated: Thus, the great yogi, always absorbed, even while living, with life and so on, with all bonds burned by the fire of knowledge,

original: dehapāte tu śiva eva jīvaṃścedṛṅmukta eva na tu kathaṃcid api baddhaḥ // / /
analyzed: dehapāte tu śivaḥ eva jīvan ca īdṛś muktaḥ eva na tu kathaṃcid api baddhaḥ
translated: But when the body falls, he is Śiva himself. If he lives like this, he is indeed liberated, but in no way bound at all.

original: na saṃśayaḥ ityanena idaṃ dhvanayati dīkṣādinā gurupratyayato muktiḥ īdṛśāt tu jñānāt samācārādvā svapratyayata eveti // / /
analyzed: na saṃśayaḥ iti anena idam dhvanayati dīkṣā ādinā guru pratyayataḥ muktiḥ īdṛśāt tu jñānāt samācārāt vā sva pratyayataḥ eva iti
translated: By there is no doubt, he suggests this: Liberation comes from initiation and so on, dependent on the guru, but from such knowledge or from proper conduct, it comes from one's own effort alone.

original: iyameva mahāsamāpattiḥ sādhakācāryādīnām abhīṣṭaprāptihetuḥ iti ślokadvayenāha // / /🔽ayamevodayastasya dhyeyasya dhyāyicetasi /
analyzed: iyam eva mahā samāpattiḥ sādhaka ācārya ādīnām abhīṣṭa prāpti hetuḥ iti śloka dvayena āha  ayam eva udayaḥ tasya dhyeyasya dhyāyi cetasi
translated: This alone is the great attainment, the cause of attaining the desired goal for the practitioner, the teacher, and so on. This is stated in two verses.🔽This alone is the rising of that object of meditation in the mind of the meditator.

original: tadātmatāsamāpattir icchataḥ sādhakasya yā // / //🔽yamevāmṛtaprāptir ayam evātmano grahaḥ /
analyzed: tad ātmatā samāpattiḥ icchataḥ sādhakasya yā  yam eva amṛta prāptiḥ ayam eva ātmanaḥ grahaḥ
translated: That attainment of identity with it, for the practitioner who desires it,🔽This alone is the attainment of immortality, this alone is the grasping of the self,

original: iyaṃ nirvāṇadīkṣā ca śivasadbhāvadāyinī // / //
analyzed: iyam nirvāṇa dīkṣā ca śiva sadbhāva dāyinī
translated: This is the initiation into nirvana, which bestows the true nature of Śiva.

original: iha śivo bhūtvā śivaṃ yajet iti yad udghoṣyate tatra dhyāyinaś cetasi saṃvedane
analyzed: iha śivaḥ bhūtvā śivam yajet iti yat udghoṣyate tatra dhyāyinaḥ cetasi saṃvedane
translated: Here, what is proclaimed as having become Śiva, one should worship Śiva, there, in the consciousness, in the mind of the meditator,

original: tasyeti na sāvasthā na yā śivaḥ iti pratipāditaśivasvabhāvasya dhyeyasya anyasya🔽vā kasyacit tattatsiddhihetor mantradevatāviśeṣasya ayam evodayaḥ prakaṭībhāvaḥ yā
analyzed: tasya iti na sā avasthā na yā śivaḥ iti pratipādita śiva svabhāvasya dhyeyasya anyasya  vā kasyacid tad tad siddhi hetoḥ mantradevatā viśeṣasya ayam eva udayaḥ prakaṭībhāvaḥ yā
translated: This is the manifestation, the clear appearance, of that which is to be meditated upon, which is of the nature of Śiva as explained, There is no state that is not Śiva,

original: sādhakasya dhyāturācāryādeḥ /
analyzed: sādhakasya dhyātuḥ ācārya ādeḥ
translated: or of any other cause of the attainment of that and that, such as a particular mantra deity, for the meditator, the practitioner, the teacher, etc.

original: tasmācchabdārthacintāsu na sāvasthā na yā śivaḥ // / /
analyzed: tasmāt śabda artha cintāsu na sā avasthā na yā śivaḥ
translated: Therefore, in thoughts about words and meanings, there is no state that is not Śiva.

original: iti pratipāditarūpā tadātmatāsamāpattiḥ śivaikyāveśo na tu pañcavaktrādervyatiriktasyākārasya
analyzed: iti pratipādita rūpā tad ātmatā samāpattiḥ śiva aikya āveśaḥ na tu pañcavaktra ādeḥ vyatiriktasya ākārasya
translated: Thus, the attainment of that nature, which is taught in this way, is the immersion in the oneness with Śiva, not the seeing of a form separate from the five faces, etc.

original: darśanaṃ na tu niścayamātreṇa tadātmatāsamāpattiḥ api tu icchato 'vikalpaviśvāhaṃtātmakaśivaikyarūpecchāparāmarśādhirūḍhasya // / /🔽etad uktaṃ bhavati ahameva tatsaṃvedanarūpeṇa tādātmyapratipattito viśvaśarīraś
analyzed: darśanam na tu niścaya mātreṇa tad ātmatā samāpattiḥ api tu icchataḥ vikalpa viśva ahaṃtā ātmaka śiva aikya rūpa icchā parāmarśa adhirūḍhasya  etat uktam bhavati aham eva tad saṃvedana rūpeṇa tādātmya pratipattitaḥ viśva śarīraḥ
translated: It is not the attainment of that nature merely through ascertainment, but rather of one who is established in the reflective awareness of the supreme will in the form of the oneness with Śiva, which is the will of the nature of the universal I-ness free from conceptualization.🔽This is what is being said: For one whose resolve ripens by becoming free from conceptualization in the form of the realization of identity through the attainment of that nature in the form of the awareness of that, I am that, the body of the universe,

original: cidānandaghanaḥ śiva iti saṃkalpo yasyāvikalpaśeṣībhūtatvena phalati tasya dhyeyamantradevatādi
translated: Śiva, the essence of consciousness and bliss, that which is to be meditated upon, the mantra deity, etc.

original: kiṃ na nāma abhimukhībhavati sarvasyaitadadvayaprathālagnatvāt // / /
analyzed: kim na nāma abhimukhībhavati sarvasya etad advaya prathā lagna tvāt
translated: Why should it not become manifest to everyone? Because of the non-dual nature of all this.

original: yathoktamasmatparameṣṭhipādaiḥ /
analyzed: yathā uktam asmat parameṣṭhi pādaiḥ
translated: As has been said by our Supreme Lord:

original: sākṣādbhavanmaye nātha sarvasmin bhuvanāntare /
analyzed: sākṣāt bhavat maye nātha sarvasmin bhuvana antare
translated: O Lord, who are present directly in all this world,

original: kiṃ na bhaktimatāṃ kṣetraṃ mantraḥ kvaiṣāṃ na sidhyati // / /
analyzed: kim na bhaktimatām kṣetram mantraḥ kva eṣām na sidhyati
translated: is there any place not sacred for the devotees? Where do their mantras not succeed?

original: iti // / /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: iyameva ca samāpattiḥ paramādvayarūpasyāmṛtasya prāptiḥ anyasmiṃs tv amṛte katipayakālaśarīradārḍhyadāyini
analyzed: iyam eva ca samāpattiḥ parama advaya rūpasya amṛtasya prāptiḥ anyasmin tu amṛte katipaya kāla śarīra dārḍhya dāyini
translated: And this very attainment is the attainment of the supreme non-dual nectar. But in other nectars, which give strength to the body for a few days,

original: prāpte'pi sādhakairmaraṇamavaśyamavāpyata evety evakārāśayaḥ // / /
analyzed: prāpte api sādhakaiḥ maraṇam avaśyam avāpyate eva iti eva kāra āśayaḥ
translated: even when attained by practitioners, death is certainly met. This is the intention of the word eva (only).

original: evaṃ sarvatrānenaivāśayena śrīsvacchande sthūladṛṣṭyāmṛtaprāptiprakaraṇe /
analyzed: evam sarvatra anena eva āśayena śrī svacchande sthūla dṛṣṭyā amṛta prāpti prakaraṇe
translated: Thus, everywhere with this very intention, in the chapter on the attainment of nectar from a gross perspective in the venerable Svacchanda,

original: naiva cāmṛtayogena kālamṛtyujayo bhavet // / /
analyzed: na eva ca amṛta yogena kāla mṛtyu jayaḥ bhavet
translated: and by the statement: And there will be no conquest of death by the yoga of nectar,

original: ityuktyopasaṃhṛtya tāttvikas tatprāptiprakāraḥ /
analyzed: iti uktyā upasaṃhṛtya tāttvikaḥ tad prāpti prakāraḥ
translated: having concluded, the true way of attaining that is

original: athavā paratattvasthaḥ sarvakālairna bādhyate // / /
analyzed: athavā para tattva sthaḥ sarva kālaiḥ na bādhyate
translated: Or else, one who abides in the supreme reality is not obstructed by any time.

original: ityādinā // / /
analyzed: ityādinā
translated: Thus, and so on.

original: sarvaṃ śivaśaktimayaṃ smaret // / /
analyzed: sarvam śiva śakti mayam smaret
translated: One should remember everything as pervaded by Śiva and Śakti.

original: iti madhyena /
analyzed: iti madhyena
translated: Thus, by the middle (verse).

original: jīvann eva vimukto 'sau yasyeyaṃ bhāvanā sadā /
analyzed: jīvan eva vimuktaḥ sau yasya iyam bhāvanā sadā
translated: He who always meditates on this is liberated even while living.

original: yaḥ śivaṃ bhāvayen nityaṃ na kālaḥ kalayettu tam /🔽yogī svacchandayogena svacchandagaticāriṇā /
analyzed: yaḥ śivam bhāvayet nityam na kālaḥ kalayet tu tam
translated: Time does not affect him who always meditates on Śiva.🔽The yogi, by the yoga of his own will, moving according to his own will,

original: sa svacchandapade yuktaḥ svacchandasamatāṃ vrajet /
analyzed: sa svacchanda pade yuktaḥ svacchanda sama tām vrajet
translated: united in the state of his own will, attains the state of equality with his own will.

original: svacchandaścaiva svacchandaḥ svacchando vicaret sadā // / /
analyzed: svacchandaḥ ca eva svacchandaḥ svacchandaḥ vicaret sadā
translated: And he who is his own will, he is his own will, he should always move according to his own will.

original: ityanena sahajasaṃdarbheṇa sapraśaṃsaṃ paścādupadiṣṭaḥ // / /
analyzed: iti anena sahaja saṃdarbheṇa sapraśaṃsam paścāt upadiṣṭaḥ
translated: Thus, with this natural context, it is praised and then taught later.

original: ayamevātmano graho jñānaṃ yaducyate ātmā jñātavya iti tatredam eva sarvajñasarvakartṛsvatantraśivasvarūpatayā pratyabhijñānam ātmano jñānaṃ
analyzed: ayam eva ātmanaḥ grahaḥ jñānam yat ucyate ātmā jñātavyaḥ iti tatra idam eva sarvajña sarva kartṛ svatantra śiva svarūpa tayā pratyabhijñānam ātmanaḥ jñānam
translated: This very recognition of the self is called knowledge, that it is said the self should be known. There, this very recognition of the self as having the nature of Śiva, the omniscient, all-acting, independent one, is the knowledge of the self.

original: na tu /
analyzed: na tu
translated: But not.

original: puruṣa evedaṃ sarvam // / /
analyzed: puruṣaḥ eva idam sarvam
translated: The person alone is all this.

original: iti śrutyantaviduktam /
analyzed: iti śruti anta vid uktam
translated: Thus it is said in the end of the Vedas.

original: ta ātmopāsakāḥ sarve na gacchanti paraṃ padam // / /
analyzed: te ātma upāsakāḥ sarve na gacchanti param padam
translated: All those who worship the self do not go to the highest state.

original: ityāmnāyokteḥ // / /
analyzed: iti āmnāya ukteḥ
translated: Thus it is said in the scriptures.

original: tathā dīkṣāvasare yojanikādyarthamayameva śiṣyātmano'nugrahaḥ imāmeva samāpattiṃ vidvānācāryaḥ śiṣyātmānaṃ śive yojayannācāryo bhavatītyarthaḥ
analyzed: tathā dīkṣā avasare yojanikā ādi artham ayam eva śiṣya ātmanaḥ nugrahaḥ imām eva samāpattim vidvān ācāryaḥ śiṣya ātmānam śive yojayan ācāryaḥ bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: Similarly, on the occasion of initiation, this very grace of the disciple's self for the purpose of connection etc., the teacher who knows this very attainment, uniting the disciple's self with Śiva, becomes the teacher. This is the meaning.

original: iyaṃ svapratyayasiddhā putrakādeḥ śivātmanaḥ sadbhāvasya pāramārthikasvarūpasya dāyinī nirvāṇadīkṣā // / /
analyzed: iyam sva pratyaya siddhā putraka ādeḥ śiva ātmanaḥ sadbhāvasya pāramārthika svarūpasya nirvāṇa dīkṣā
translated: This is the Nirvāṇa initiation, which bestows the true nature of the existence of the son and others as Śiva, established by one's own experience.

original: yathoktam /
analyzed: yathā uktam
translated: As it is said:

original: evaṃ yo veda tattvena tasya nirvāṇadāyinī /
analyzed: evam yaḥ veda tattvena tasya nirvāṇa dāyinī
translated: Thus, for one who knows this truth, the initiation bestows Nirvāṇa,

original: dīkṣā bhavatyasaṃdigdhā tilājyāhutivarjitā // / /
analyzed: dīkṣā bhavati asaṃdigdhā tila ājya āhuti varjitā
translated: free from doubt, without the offering of sesame and ghee.

original: iti // / /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: hautrī dīkṣāpi dīkṣaiva tatra mā bhūt kasyacid anāśvāsa ityāśayenātraivakāro na kṛtaḥ śrīmahāgurupravareṇeti śivam // / /
analyzed: hautrī dīkṣā api dīkṣā eva tatra mā bhūt kasyacid anāśvāsaḥ iti āśayena atra eva kāraḥ na kṛtaḥ śrī mahā guru pravareṇa iti śivam  /
translated: The initiation of the Hotṛ is also initiation. To prevent anyone from losing confidence, the word eva (only) is not used here by the illustrious supreme guru. Thus it is auspicious.

original: spandakārikā /
translated: Spanda Verses.

original: tṛtīyo niḥṣyandaḥ🔽yathecchābhyarthito dhātā jāgrato 'rthān hṛdi sthitān /
analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ niḥṣyandaḥ  yathā icchā abhyarthitaḥ dhātā jāgrataḥ rthān hṛdi sthitān
translated: Third Outpouring

original: somasūryodayaṃ kṛtvā sampādayati dehinaḥ // / //
analyzed: soma sūrya udayam kṛtvā sampādayati dehinaḥ
translated: Just as the creator, when requested by one who is awake, having caused the rising of the moon and sun, accomplishes the objects that are in the heart of embodied beings,

original: tathā svapne'pyabhīṣṭārthān praṇayasyānatikramāt /
analyzed: tathā svapne pi abhīṣṭa arthān praṇayasya anatikramāt
translated: in the same way, in a dream also, he accomplishes the desired objects, not transgressing affection,

original: nityaṃ sphuṭataraṃ madhye sthito'vaśyaṃ prakāśayet // / //
analyzed: nityam sphuṭataram madhye sthitaḥ uvaśyam prakāśayet
translated: He who is always very clear in the middle, must certainly manifest.

original: dhatte sarvamātmanīti dhātā śaṃkarātmā svabhāvaḥ sa yathā jāgrataḥ jāgarāyāmabhivyaktasvasvātantryasya🔽dehino dehabhūmikāmeva prakaṭībhūtapiṇḍasthajñānasya yoginaḥ sambandhinyecchayābhyarthito
analyzed: dhatte sarvam ātmani iti dhātā śaṃkara ātmā svabhāvaḥ sa yathā jāgrataḥ jāgarāyām abhivyakta sva svātantryasya  dehinaḥ deha bhūmikām eva prakaṭībhūta piṇḍa stha jñānasya yoginaḥ sambandhinyā icchayā abhyarthitaḥ
translated: The creator, whose nature is Śaṅkara, holds everything in himself. As for the one who is awake, in the state of waking, whose independence is manifest,🔽the embodied one, the yogi whose knowledge residing in the aggregate is manifested only on the plane of the body, requested by the will,

original: 'ntarmukhasvarūpavimarśabalena prasādito hṛdi cetasi sthitānarthāniti bindunādādijñānapuraḥ🔽kṣobhapratibhācālanabodhastobhajñānasaṃcārādiprayojanāni sampādayati // / /🔽kathaṃ somasūryayor jñānakriyāśaktyor udayaṃ kṛtvā jñānaśaktyā bhāsyamānaṃ hi tattatkriyāśaktyonmīlyate // / /
analyzed: antar mukha svarūpa vimarśa balena prasāditaḥ hṛdi cetasi sthitān arthān iti bindu nāda ādi jñāna puraḥ  kṣobha pratibhā cālana bodha stobha jñāna saṃcāra ādi prayojanāni sampādayati  katham soma sūryayoḥ jñāna kriyāśaktyoḥ udayam kṛtvā jñānaśaktyā bhāsyamānam hi tat tat kriyāśaktyā unmīlyate

original: samāveśonmiṣatpratibhātmakamūlāvaṣṭambhayuktisphāritajñānakriyāvyāptisārasavyetaramarīcivisphāraṇakrameṇa
translated: By the process of expanding the rays of the sun and moon, which is the essence of the pervasion of knowledge and action expanded by the logic of the root support consisting of the brilliance that arises from the union,

original: yathā caivaṃ tathā /
analyzed: yathā ca evam tathā

original: anāgatāyāṃ nidrāyāṃ vinaṣṭe bāhyagocare /
analyzed: anāgatāyām nidrāyām vinaṣṭe bāhya gocare

original: iti // / /
analyzed: iti

analyzed: pīnām ca durbalām śaktim dhyātvā dvādaśagocare
translated: And having contemplated the gross and subtle power in the twelve-fold sphere,

analyzed: praviśya hṛdaye dhyāyan svapna svātantryam āpnuyāt
translated: Entering into the heart and meditating, one attains freedom in dreams.

original: iti sampradāyasthityā vamanagrāsasaktatadubhayavisargāraṇicitiśaktiparāmarśamukhena

analyzed: nityam praṇayam an atikrāmataḥ bhagavat prārthanā parasya yoga nidrā ārūḍhasya sphuṭataram
translated: One who is always devoted, intent on praying to the Lord, and who has mounted the yoga sleep,🔽Clearly,

original: anācchāditarūpatayā madhye sauṣumnadhāmani sthito dhātā svapne 'pyabhīṣṭān evāṇavaśāktaśāmbhavasamāveśādīn
analyzed: an ācchādita rūpa tayā madhye sauṣumna dhāmani sthitaḥ dhātā svapne pi abhīṣṭān eva āṇava śākta śāmbhava samāveśa ādīn

original: anyān api samāveśābhyāsarasonmṛṣṭamatimukurasya jijñāsitān arthān avaśyaṃ prakaṭīkaroti

translated: And other states that are desired by one whose mental mirror is cleansed by the taste of the practice of states, he certainly reveals.

original: nāsya yoginaḥ svapnasuṣuptayor vyāmoho bhavatītyarthaḥ // / /
analyzed: na asya yoginaḥ svapna suṣuptayoḥ vyāmohaḥ bhavati iti arthaḥ

translated: By the word 'dream', deep sleep is also indicated.

original: māyākāluṣyopaśamalakṣaṇasya prasādasya bhagavatānatikramāt // / /

translated: Here, in the manifestation of the desired object, this very cause is by repetition. original: parameśvaro hi cidātmā yady antarmukhocitasevākrameṇārthyate tat tat saṃpādayata

original: eva jāgrataḥ iti paratattve jāgarūkasya jāgarāvasthāsthasya ceti śleṣoktyā vyākhyeyam // / /

translated: Even for one who is awake, it should be explained by the pun that he is in the state of wakefulness, being alert in the supreme reality.

original: yadi punarevaṃ sāvadhāno na bhavati tadā nāsya yogitetyāha // / /
analyzed: yadi punar evam sāvadhānaḥ na bhavati tadā na asya yogitā iti āha

original: ityarthaḥ // / /
analyzed: iti arthaḥ

original: yathoktam /
analyzed: yathā uktam

analyzed: pravṛttiḥ bhūtānām aiśvarī

original: iti // / /
analyzed: iti

analyzed: hi śabdaḥ kila śabda arthe

translated: Even in an attentive mind, the object is seen to be unclear due to faults such as distance, etc. By repeatedly examining it with direct perception,

translated: Since it is so, this collection of accomplishments arises from this in the order of the reasoning of the stated aphorism.

translated: so it will be everywhere in the same way by the presiding of the Self.🔽When the body is presided over, pervaded, by this, by the essence of vibration which is of the nature of one's own nature, as the embodied one's qualities such as omniscience, omnipotence, etc.,

original: sarvajñatāsarvakartṛtādayo dharmā āvirbhavanti dehinaḥ tathā yadyayaṃ kūrmāṅgasaṃkocavat
analyzed: sarvajña tā sarva kartṛ tā ādayaḥ dharmāḥ āvirbhavanti dehinaḥ tathā yadi ayam kūrma aṅga saṃkoca vat

translated: In the same way, with regard to Śiva and others up to the earth, he will be of the nature of Śaṅkara, his proper omniscience, omnipotence, and so on.

original: idam apyetatprasādenetyāha // / /
analyzed: idam api etad prasādena iti āha
translated: This also is by his grace, he says:

original: glānir viluṇṭhikā dehe tasyāścājñānataḥ sṛtiḥ /
analyzed: glāniḥ viluṇṭhikā dehe tasyāḥ ca ajñānataḥ sṛtiḥ
translated: Depression is a plunderer in the body, and its course is from ignorance.

analyzed: tad unmeṣa viluptam ced kutas sā syāt ahetukā

translated: The body is the abode of all the hairs, and therefore the depression in the body, that is, the loss of joy for the person who identifies with the body,

analyzed: viluṇṭhikā para saṃvid draviṇa apahāreṇa pārimitya daurgatya pradā tasyāḥ ca glāneḥ ajñānataḥ
